meanings.definition: a person who spoils the pleasure of others
meanings.sent1: Don't be a spoilsport and ruin the fun for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The spoilsport at the party complained about the music being too loud.
meanings.sent3: The spoilsport in the group always brings up boring topics during conversations.
meanings.sent4: Her negative attitude made her the spoilsport of the team, dampening everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The little brother was always the spoilsport, never wanting to play along with his siblings.

meanings.definition: to behave in a way that spoils the enjoyment of others
meanings.sent1: Please don't spoilsport our plans by canceling at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: She tends to spoilsport by criticizing every idea without offering alternatives.
meanings.sent3: He tried to spoilsport the surprise party by accidentally revealing the location.
meanings.sent4: The rainy weather threatened to spoilsport our picnic in the park.
meanings.sent5: Their constant bickering started to spoilsport the friendly atmosphere of the gathering.
